item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 胆小的科技股投资者转而从英伟达业绩中寻找下一步线索
item.description: 随着投资者对全球市值最大、华尔街人工智能交易核心企业英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）季度报告的反应，科技股的动荡可能在下周加剧。【原文：Turbulence in technology stocks could ratchet higher in the coming week as investors react to the quarterly report from Nvidia Corp , the world's largest company by market value that is at the heart of Wall Street's artificial intelligence trade.】

item.title: 12月降息预期减弱，美国期货下跌
item.description: 在美联储官员的鹰派言论增加了市场对 12 月降息的疑虑之后，美国股指期货周五下跌，预示着华尔街将出现新一轮抛售。【原文：U.S. stock index futures dipped on Friday, signaling a fresh round of selloff on Wall Street after hawkish comments from Federal Reserve officials added to doubts about an interest rate cut in December.】

item.title: 长达数周的网络关闭后，捷豹路虎英国生产恢复正常
item.description: 捷豹路虎周五表示，在网络攻击迫使其英国工厂停工六周、扰乱供应链并导致该汽车制造商损失数亿英镑之后，其生产运营已恢复正常。【原文：Jaguar Land Rover said on Friday its manufacturing operations had returned to normal after a cyberattack forced a six-week halt at its UK plants, disrupting supply chains and costing the carmaker hundreds of millions of pounds.】

item.title: 瑞美贸易协定细节可能于周五浮出水面
item.description: 历峰集团（Richemont）董事长约翰-鲁伯特（Johann Rupert）表示，瑞士和美国之间可能达成的降低瑞士出口产品 39% 关税的协议细节最快可能在周五公布，但可能要在几个月后才能签署。【原文：Details of a potential deal between Switzerland and the United States to reduce the crippling 39% tariffs on Swiss exports could emerge as soon as Friday, but it may be months before it is signed, Richemont Chairman Johann Rupert said.】

item.title: 阿提哈德航空九个月利润增长 26%，客运收入猛增
item.description: 阿提哈德航空公司周五公布，由于客运和货运业务收入增加，九个月利润达到 17 亿迪拉姆（约合 4.63 亿美元），同比增长 26%。【原文：Etihad Airways reported a nine-month profit of 1.7 billion dirhams ($463 million) on Friday, up 26% year-on-year, driven by higher revenue in both its passenger and cargo businesses.】

item.title: 标准普尔将日产汽车评级从 BB 下调至 BB-
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司周五表示，由于日产汽车的盈利能力持续面临压力，该公司已将其信用评级下调一个等级，同时对这家日本汽车制造商的前景持负面看法。【原文：S&P Global Ratings said on Friday it has downgraded its rating of Nissan Motor's credit by one notch on continuing pressure on its profitability, while taking a negative view of the outlook for the Japanese automaker.】

item.title: 迪拜航展将展示西方喷气机订单，中国将首次亮相竞争者
item.description: 在下周举行的迪拜航展上，飞机延误、中国取代空客和波音的野心以及地缘政治紧张局势将与新喷气机订单争夺人们的注意力。【原文：Aircraft delays, China's ambitions to dethrone Airbus and Boeing , and geopolitical tensions will vie for attention with new jet orders at next week's Dubai Airshow.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，由于芯片短缺加剧，三星将内存芯片价格最高上调 60
item.description: 两位知情人士称，三星电子本月提高了某些内存芯片的价格--由于全球竞相建设人工智能数据中心，目前这些芯片供不应求--与 9 月份相比，涨幅高达 60%。【原文：Samsung Electronics this month raised prices of certain memory chips - now in short supply due to the global race to build AI data centres - by as much as 60% compared to September, two people with knowledge of the hikes said.】

item.title: 日本汽车工会组织誓言：尽管关税带来痛苦，但在工资要求上绝不退缩
item.description: 日本顶级汽车行业工会组织负责人周五告诉路透社，尽管美国关税严重拖累了该行业的收益，但该组织并不打算在明年的劳资谈判中降低工资要求。【原文：Japan's top automobile industry union group has no plans to scale back its wage demands at labour talks next year despite a heavy drag on the sector's earnings from U.S. tariffs, its chief told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: ACS 与贝莱德推出价值 20 亿欧元的数据中心合资企业
item.description: 西班牙 ACS 公司周五表示，该公司与贝莱德全球基础设施合作伙伴公司（BlackRock's Global Infrastructure Partners）成立了一家合资企业，将初步开发 20 亿欧元（23.3 亿美元）、1.7 千兆瓦的数据中心组合。【原文：Spain's ACS and BlackRock's Global Infrastructure Partners have created a joint venture to develop an initial 2 billion euro ($2.33 billion), 1.7 gigawatt portfolio of data centres, the Spanish company said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称，Stellantis 将召回近 113,000 辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周五表示，克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特将召回112,859辆美国汽车，因为发动机内的碎片可能导致发动机故障或车厢起火。【原文：Chrysler-parent Stellantis is recalling 112,859 U.S. vehicles as debris inside the engine could cause an engine failure or compartment fire, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Friday.】

item.title: 希腊在欧洲刑警组织打击网络犯罪的全球 "终局 "行动中逮捕一名男子
item.description: 警方表示，希腊逮捕了一名 38 岁的男子，这是欧洲刑警组织打击国际网络犯罪行动的一部分，在此期间，当局摧毁了感染全球数十万台计算机的恶意软件基础设施。【原文：Greece has arrested a 38-year-old man as part of a Europol crackdown on international cybercrime, during which authorities dismantled malware infrastructure that has infected hundreds of thousands of computers worldwide, police said.】

item.title: iPhone 17 发布一个月后，苹果在中国的 iPhone 销量猛增 22
item.description: 周五的一项民间调查显示，iPhone 17 系列上市后的第一个月，中国的 iPhone 销量比去年同期增长了 22%，尽管整个市场有所疲软。【原文：Sales of iPhones in China rose 22% from year-earlier levels in the first month after the iPhone 17 series launched, even as the broader market softened, a private survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 焦点：消息人士称，比亚迪已放弃令供应商紧张的内部支付系统
item.description: 据知情人士透露，中国比亚迪已告知一些供应商，该公司希望停止使用内部财务票据向供应商付款。【原文：China's BYD has told some suppliers it wants to stop using in-house financial notes to pay them, people briefed on the matter said - a seismic shift away from a practice that helped power its rise but has been criticised for disadvantaging its parts makers.】

item.title: 卡地亚所有者历峰集团的季度销售额超出预期，销售额跃升 14
item.description: 总部位于日内瓦的奢侈品集团历峰集团周五公布的季度销售额好于预期，该集团正在等待瑞士与美国之间关税谈判的结果。【原文：Cartier-owner Richemont reported better-than-expected quarterly sales on Friday, as the Geneva-based luxury group awaited the outcome of tariff negotiations between Switzerland and the United States.】

item.title: 数据 "迷雾 "令部分投资者徘徊不前
item.description: 美国停摆已经结束，但对投资者来说，宿醉才刚刚开始，他们担心在股市的微妙时刻，经济数据的差距将推迟甚至破坏美联储的降息计划。【原文：The U.S. shutdown has ended but the hangover is just beginning for investors, who worry gaps in economic data will delay or even derail Federal Reserve rate cuts at a delicate moment for the stock market.】

item.title: 摩根大通拓展迪拜市场，推动全球中型企业发展
item.description: 摩根大通的一位高管告诉路透社，摩根大通在迪拜扩大了业务，这是摩根大通在中东及其他地区与中型企业发展和开展更多业务的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：The U.S. bank JPMorgan has expanded in Dubai as part of a broader push to grow and do more business with medium-sized companies in the Middle East and beyond, an executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 谷歌提议欧盟改变广告技术政策，但不撤资
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构要求谷歌出售部分业务以解决利益冲突问题，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司不听劝阻，提出让出版商和广告商更容易使用其在线广告技术。【原文：Alphabet's Google has offered to make it easier for publishers and advertisers to use its online advertising technology, defying EU antitrust regulators' call for it to sell part of the business to address conflicts of interest.】

item.title: 瑞士机械制造商感受到汽车行业放缓和特朗普关税的热度
item.description: Norbert Steuer 是瑞士精密机械制造商 K.R. Pfiffner 的一名后勤工人，已经在这家公司工作了三十多年。现在，他是 105 名员工中即将被解雇的 80 名员工之一，因为该公司正受到美国关税和汽车业困境的影响。【原文：Norbert Steuer, a logistics worker at Swiss precision machinery maker K.R. Pfiffner, has been at the firm for over three decades. Now he is one of 80 out of 105 staff due to be let go as it reels from U.S. tariffs and a struggling auto industry.】

item.title: 澳新银行审查发现 "好消息 "文化掩盖了问题
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）对该银行及其非金融风险管理实践的审查发现，"好消息 "文化阻碍了员工对潜在错误直言不讳，而官僚作风则阻碍了部分流程。【原文：Australia's ANZ Group has a 'good news' culture that deters staff from speaking up about potential mistakes while bureaucracy hampers some of its processes, a review into the bank and its non-financial risk management practices has found.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储减息悬而未决，市场暴跌
item.description: 格雷戈尔-斯图尔特-亨特对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Gregor Stuart Hunter】

item.title: 投资者摆脱对估值的担忧，Pine Labs 印度首秀股价大涨 10
item.description: 金融科技公司 Pine Labs 的股票在周五的首次交易中上涨了近 10%，原因是投资者摆脱了对盈利能力和估值捉襟见肘的担忧。【原文：Shares of fintech firm Pine Labs rose nearly 10% in their trading debut on Friday as investors shrugged off concerns over profitability and stretched valuations.】

item.title: 中芯国际称对内存短缺的担忧促使客户推迟第一季度订单
item.description: 中国最大的合同芯片制造商中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp 0981.HK）周五表示，对内存芯片短缺的担忧与日俱增，正促使其客户推迟其他类型半导体的订单。【原文：Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp 0981.HK, China's largest contract chipmaker, on Friday said growing worries about a shortage of memory chips are prompting its customers to hold back their orders for other types of semiconductors.】

item.title: 作为全球改革的一部分，日产汽车将削减欧洲地区办事处的工作岗位
item.description: 一份公司文件和内部电子邮件显示，作为首席执行官伊万-埃斯皮诺萨（Ivan Espinosa）全球重组和扭亏计划的一部分，日产汽车将在其位于法国的欧洲地区办事处裁撤 87 个职位，其中包括裁员 15%。【原文：Nissan will eliminate 87 positions at its European regional office in France, a company document and internal emails showed, as part of CEO Ivan Espinosa's global restructuring and turnaround plan that includes a 15% cut in headcount.】

item.title: 乌克兰袭击导致俄罗斯油库受损，石油价格攀升逾 2
item.description: 乌克兰无人机袭击破坏了俄罗斯黑海港口新罗西斯克的一个油库，油价周五上涨超过 2%。【原文：Oil prices rose more than 2% on Friday after a Ukrainian drone attack damaged an oil depot in the Russian Black Sea port of Novorossiysk.】

item.title: 中国工厂产出和零售额增速为一年多来最差
item.description: 10月份，中国的工厂产出和零售额增速为一年多来最弱，这给决策者带来了压力，要求他们重整这个19万亿美元的出口导向型经济体，因为日益加剧的供需紧张有可能进一步抑制经济增长。【原文：China's factory output and retail sales grew at their weakest pace in over a year in October, piling pressure on policymakers to revamp the $19 trillion export-driven economy as mounting supply and demand strains threaten to further curtail growth.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：亚马逊和微软支持限制英伟达对华出口的努力
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，亚马逊正与微软一道支持立法，进一步限制芯片制造商英伟达（Nvidia）向中国出口的能力。【原文：Amazon is joining Microsoft in backing legislation to further limit chipmaker Nvidia's ability to export to China, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国和韩国公布包括韩国投资造船业在内的交易细节
item.description: 美国和韩国周五公布了一项贸易协定的细节，其中包括韩国将向美国造船业投资1500亿美元，另外还将向工业部门投资2000亿美元。【原文：The U.S. and South Korea released details of a trade agreement on Friday that includes a $150 billion Korean investment in the American shipbuilding sector and an additional $200 billion earmarked for industrial sectors, the two countries said.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司首席执行官称波音 777-9 延误不会造成重大影响
item.description: 新加坡航空公司首席执行官吴俊峰（Goh Choon Phong）周五表示，新加坡航空公司预计波音777-9飞机延迟交付不会造成重大影响。【原文：Singapore Airlines is not expecting a major impact from the delay in delivery of Boeing 777-9 planes, CEO Goh Choon Phong said on Friday.】

item.title: 李明博：韩美就贸易、安全协议和核潜艇达成一致
item.description: 韩国总统李在明周五表示，在上个月与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）举行峰会后，韩美两国已就贸易和安全问题的协议敲定了一份联合概况介绍。【原文：South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said on Friday South Korea and U.S. had finalised a joint fact sheet on agreements on trade and security issues after his summit with U.S. President Donald Trump last month.】
